prophet.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
prophet.title: The Messenger of Allah
prophet.history: Born in Mecca, Muhammad ﷺ received the revelation of the Quran over 23 years. He established Islam and the first Muslim community (Ummah). He was known for his honesty, compassion, and justice.

abu-bakr.name: Abu Bakr as-Siddiq
abu-bakr.title: The Truthful One
abu-bakr.history: One of the closest companions of the Prophet ﷺ. He was the first to believe in Islam among adults. He became the first Caliph after the Prophet's death and was known for his devotion and wisdom.

umar.name: Umar ibn al-Khattab
umar.title: The Distinguisher
umar.history: A strong and just companion who became the second Caliph. He was known for his firmness, wisdom, and administrative skills. He expanded the Islamic state and implemented fair governance.

uthman.name: Uthman ibn Affan
uthman.title: The Possessor of Two Lights
uthman.history: A wealthy companion who supported Islam financially. He became the third Caliph and is most remembered for compiling the Quran into a standardized written text.

ali.name: Ali ibn Abi Talib
ali.title: The Commander of the Faithful
ali.history: Cousin and son-in-law of the Prophet ﷺ. A strong warrior and judge, known for his knowledge and courage. He became the fourth Caliph and was famous for his administrative justice.

aisha.name: Aisha bint Abi Bakr
aisha.title: The Mother of the Believers
aisha.history: The youngest wife of the Prophet ﷺ. She was a scholar of Islam, hadith narrator, and political leader. She played a crucial role in preserving Islamic knowledge.

fatima.name: Fatima bint Muhammad
fatima.title: The Mistress of the Women of Paradise
fatima.history: Daughter of the Prophet ﷺ and wife of Ali. Known for her piety, grace, and dedication to her family. She represents the ideal Muslim woman in Islamic tradition.

hamza.name: Hamza ibn Abdul-Muttalib
hamza.title: The Lion of Allah
hamza.history: Uncle of the Prophet ﷺ and a fearless warrior. He was a great military commander and died as a martyr at the Battle of Uhud, displaying courage and devotion.

bilal.name: Bilal ibn Rabah
bilal.title: The Freed Slave
bilal.history: Originally an enslaved person, Bilal was freed by Abu Bakr after converting to Islam. He became the first Muezzin (caller to prayer) and is an example of spiritual equality in Islam.

khadeejah.name: Khadijah bint Khuwaylid
khadeejah.title: The First Believer
khadeejah.history: The first wife of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ and the first to believe in his message. A successful businesswoman, she supported the Prophet ﷺ throughout the early years of Islam.

zaid.name: Zaid ibn Harithah
zaid.title: The Adopted Son
zaid.history: Adopted by the Prophet ﷺ, Zaid was a freed captive from war. He was deeply loved by the Prophet and known for his loyalty and military prowess.

jafar.name: Jafar ibn Abi Talib
jafar.title: The Flying Man
jafar.history: Brother of Ali and cousin of the Prophet ﷺ. He was a military commander known for leading expeditions. He was martyred in the Battle of Mu'tah.

abu-talib.name: Abu Talib ibn Abdul-Muttalib
abu-talib.title: The Protector of the Prophet
abu-talib.history: Uncle of the Prophet ﷺ who protected him from early persecution. Though not a Muslim, he supported the Prophet's mission. He was known for his honor and tribal position.

hasan.name: Hasan ibn Ali
hasan.title: The Noble One
hasan.history: Eldest grandson of the Prophet ﷺ through his daughter Fatima. Known for his generosity, piety, and peaceful nature. He was a bridge between conflicting factions.

husain.name: Husain ibn Ali
husain.title: The Martyr
husain.history: Younger grandson of the Prophet ﷺ. He is remembered for his martyrdom at Karbala while standing for justice and against tyranny, becoming a symbol of courage.

asma.name: Asma bint Abu Bakr
asma.title: The Woman of Two Girdles
asma.history: Sister of Aisha and daughter of Abu Bakr. She was a notable companion known for her wisdom, bravery, and piety. She lived to be over 90 years old.

talha.name: Talha ibn Ubaydullah
talha.title: The Merchant of Paradise
talha.history: One of the ten promised paradise companions. A wealthy and generous merchant who was a great supporter of Islam. He was known for his moral character and devotion.

zubayr.name: Zubayr ibn al-Awwam
zubayr.title: The Disciple of the Prophet
zubayr.history: Cousin of the Prophet ﷺ and one of the ten promised paradise. A renowned warrior and scholar, he was deeply devoted to Islam and known for his integrity.

safiyya.name: Safiyya bint Abdul-Muttalib
safiyya.title: The Aunt of the Prophet
safiyya.history: Aunt of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ. She was one of the early believers and a supportive figure. She participated in the defense of Medina during battles.

abbas.name: Abbas ibn Abdul-Muttalib
abbas.title: The Uncle of the Prophet
abbas.history: Uncle of the Prophet ﷺ. Though he accepted Islam later, he became a devoted companion. His descendants, the Abbasid dynasty, founded one of Islam's great caliphates.

abdullah-abbas.name: Abdullah ibn Abbas
abdullah-abbas.title: The Learned One
abdullah-abbas.history: Son of Abbas and cousin of the Prophet ﷺ. One of the greatest Islamic scholars and interpreters of the Quran. His knowledge was widely sought and respected.

khalid.name: Khalid ibn Walid
khalid.title: The Sword of Allah
khalid.history: Initially an opponent of Islam but later a devoted companion. He became one of Islam's greatest military strategists and never lost a single battle he commanded.

abdur-rahman.name: Abdur-Rahman ibn Awf
abdur-rahman.title: The Wealthy Generous One
abdur-rahman.history: One of the ten promised paradise. A wealthy merchant and wise counselor. He was known for his generosity, business acumen, and moral guidance.

usman-ibn-talha.name: Uthman ibn Talha
usman-ibn-talha.title: The Keeper of the House
usman-ibn-talha.history: Son of Talha, he was a devoted companion. He served as a guardian of the Kaaba and was known for his piety and responsibility in maintaining the sacred house.
